channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- MF Gig Calendar
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- MF Gig Calendar

item.title: CVE-2021-24510|2024-08-03T19:35:20.087Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin before 1.2 does not sanitise and escape the id GET parameter before outputting back in the admin dashboard when editing an Event, leading to a reflected Cross-Site Scripting issue

item.title: CVE-2024-3756|2024-06-12T14:38:30.616Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin through 1.2.1 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in Contributors and above delete arbitrary events via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3755|2024-06-04T17:31:46.642Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin through 1.2.1 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3756|2024-05-06T06:00:02.125Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin through 1.2.1 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in Contributors and above delete arbitrary events via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3755|2024-08-01T20:20:01.098Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin through 1.2.1 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3756|2024-08-01T20:20:00.980Z -- unknown -- mf%20gig%20calendar
item.description: The MF Gig Calendar WordPress plugin through 1.2.1 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in Contributors and above delete arbitrary events via a CSRF attack
